Directions
Combine flour, yeast, and salt in a large bowl and whisk until homogenous. Add oil and water and stir with wooden spoon until combined. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise at room temperature at least 8 hours and up to 24.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
The next day, turn dough out onto lightly floured surface and divide in half. Form balls with each half, then place into lightly oiled bowls, coating all surfaces of the balls with oil. Cover with plastic wrap and set aside at room temperature.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
Meanwhile, make the sauce. Heat olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add garlic, oregano, and pepper flakes and cook for 30 seconds until fragrant. Add tomato paste and cook, stirring constantly for 1 minute. Add 2/3 of crushed tomatoes and stir to combine. Reduce heat to lowest setting and cook, stirring occasionally for 1 hour. Stir in remaining crushed tomatoes and season to taste with salt. Remove from heat and set aside.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
Stretch the dough: Coat two 10-inch cast iron skillets (or cake pans/oven-safe nonstick skillets) with 1 tablespoon each of shortening and olive oil. Transfer dough balls one at a time to a large cookie sheet and stretch out into a 10-inch circle. Transfer the circles to the greased skillets. Cover and allow to rise for 1 hour at room temperature. Meanwhile, adjust the oven rack to the bottom position and preheat oven to 500°F (260°C). Combine the cheeses in a large bowl and cover until ready to use.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
When dough has risen, top each circle with 1 cup of sauce (you will have leftover sauce), spreading it to within half an inch of the edge. Divide grated cheese evenly between the two pies, spreading it all the way to the edge of each pie.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
Bake pies until top is bubbly and golden brown in spots and cheese has charred around edges, 15 to 20 minutes. Remove pizzas from oven and using a thin metal spatula, release the edges from the pans. Carefully lift pies to check for doneness underneath. If you'd like a darker bottom crust, set each pie directly over a medium-low flame and cook, turning occasionally until desired level of doneness is reached.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
Slide pizzas onto cutting board, allow to rest 2 minutes, slice, and serve immediately. For best results, pizzas should be eaten within 15 minutes of baking.
Serious Eats / Qi Ai
